result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William N Kitowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Kryshak (sent for review)
Filed by Defense.

Defendant William N Kitowski in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 15CF-53, 15CM-99, 15CM-153, 15CT-32, 15TR-116, 16CF-287, 16CM-5, 17CF-9 and 17CM-53.

8:41 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.
There is a plea agreement.

15CT-32: Defendant will plead to charge.   
16CF-287: Defendant will plead to Count 2 and Count 4. Count 1 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in. 
15CF-53: Dismissed and read in with understanding restitution owed will be paid on other case
Rest of the cases will be dismissed and read in.

All cash bond posted in all cases to be applied first to restitution, then to fines/costs.
Atty Kryshak is court appointed. Defendant has failed to make payments for attorney fees.
Defendant understands that he will pay attorney fees.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim is not present at this time.

Atty Kryshak concurs with plea agreement.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT-32: NO CONTEST
16CF-287: Count 2: NO CONTEST
16CF-287: Count 4: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defense agrees the OWI is a third offense.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CT-32:  OWI 3rd
16CF-287: Count 1: Dismissed and read in
16CF-287: Count 2: Possession of THC
16CF-287: Count 3: Dismissed and read in
16CF-287: Count 4: Misdemeanor Bailjumping
15CF-53: Dismissed and read in 
15CM-99: Dismissed and read in 
15CM-153: Dismissed and read in
15TR-116: Dismissed and read in
16CM-5: Dismissed and read in
17CF-9: Dismissed and read in
17CM-53: Dismissed and read in

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Cout has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CT-32:
Count 1:
100 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Court will allow early discharge if conditions are met and all fines/costs are paid in full
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 75 Days
First 27 days in custody, remainder may be served on electronic home monitoring if Defendant qualifies
Jail credit for 27 days already served
Jail sentence to start within 60 days
Report today to set up start time
Pay a fine of $1,200 which totals $2,452
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Pay attorney fees
Drivers License Revoked 31 Months
IID 31 Months

16CF-287:
Count 2:
150 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
Concurrent to 15CT-32
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Concurrent to 15CT-32
Court will allow early discharge if conditions are met and all fines/costs are paid in full
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CT-32
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Restitution of $2,000 to K.F.
Pay attorney fees
AODA and comly with treatment plan

Count 4:
150 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
Concurrent to Count 2 and 15CT-32
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Concurrent to Count 2 and Concurrent to 15CT-32
Court will allow early discharge if conditions are met and all fines/costs are paid in full
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2 and 15CT-32
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay attorney fees

Defendant to set up payment plan before probation is completed
All cash bond previously posted are to be applied toward restitution, then atty fees, then fines/costs
from Br 1 Judge to Atty Kryshak dated 05/19/17 in re:  failure to make payments towards the attorney fee's starting on March 3, 2017
Plea hearing on June 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on March 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
FYI: Receipt to Original filed in 15CF53. $500 per month with 1st payment by 03-03-17. Atty Kryshak appointed.
Status conference on January 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant William N Kitowski in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Court reviews the file.  Defendant had an indigency hearing and he was found partially indigent. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Clerk notes the following cases were set for Status Conference:  16CM5, 16CF287, 15CT32, 15CM153, 15CM99, 15CF53
Defendant asks to drop the day report as he has tripped 2 times  already.  
Court has the defendant sign the Petition for Appointment of Counsel. 
Atty Gary Kryshak is present in the Courtroom and is willing to accept the appointment at this time. 
Court questions Atty Kryshak. 

BY THE COURT: ALL BONDS THAT HE IS REQUIRED TO DAY REPORT ARE AMENDED TO REPORT ON THE DAYS HE IS SCHEDULED FOR COURT. 
Court removes the Pre-trial Supervision Program requirement in 15CT32.

Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on January 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William N Kitowski appeared by video. ADA Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CM99, 15CT32, 15CF53, 15CM153, 16CM5, 16CF287 on warrants. New Bail Jumping charges will be filed.
State requests $2,000 cash bond w/conditions.

Just on new charges BTC: $1,500 cash
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  14 times

The other cases will follow as status cases 15CM99, 15CT32, 15CF53, 15CM153.
New charges are scheduled for Initial on  01-09-17 at 01:30 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
cc:  DA w/ minutes on 12/20/16 sp
Body only - JR

10:48 a.m. Defendant William N Kitowski not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF53, 15CT32, 15TR116, 15CM153, 15CM99, 16CF287, 16CM5, and 16CF287are scheduled for today. State requests warrants. BY THE COURT: Warrants body only.
Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William N Kitowski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:40 a.m.  Court calls case
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court is not able to proceed to a Plea/Sentencing Hearing today as the defendant has accrued additional charges.
Defendant is informed to go to the Public Defenders Office to see about obtaining representation.
Defendant makes statement.
Defendant informed to go to the DA's Office to obtain a copy of criminal complaint(s) to take over to the Public Defender's Office.
Defendant makes additional statements that he is paying $1,200/month in medical expenses.
Defendant is informed by the Court to still go to the Public Defender's Office to see if he could get representation.
Defendant makes a final statement.

BY THE COURT:
Cases adjourned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Original filed in 15CF53
Plea hearing on July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William N Kitowski not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15TR-116, 15CT-32, 15CM-153, 15CF-53, 15CM-99 and 16CM-5.

8:40 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

A fax was received from Ministry Health Care. There are no restrictions listed. Defendant is being seen as a patient.

State has no prior information, had an agreement in place. State questions if this is a valid excuse. The notes are vague. 

Court reviews the fax, reads the fax for the record.

Court will set matter for status conference.

Court apologizes to victim who is present this morning.

Victim addresses the Court, would like to get this over with.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Fax from Ministry Health Care. Original filed in 15CT-32.
Plea hearing at 04-13-2016 08:30 am
Plea hearing at 01-14-2016 01:30 pm
Plea hearing at 10-13-2015 01:30 pm
Plea hearing at 08-12-2015 08:30 am
Status conference at 06-08-2015 01:30 pm
6/4/15 M.Z. Signature bond has been amended to a cash bond.  Same conditions as before: No contact with Kenneth Firkus.

Defendant William N Kitowski appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:27 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states apperances.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, Defendant failed to appear at the last hearing.

Defendant addresses the Court, lost his attorney and did not have a notice sent to him.
Court verifies address.

Defendant replies, did not get another date to appear in Court.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.
Atty Knaapen requests cash bond with conditions. 

Clerk reviews minutes from preliminary hearing, for the record.

Defendant requests signature bond and requests another lawyer.
cc:da w/minutes 05-12-15 ss
$500 cash alternative - sent to JR

Defendant William N Kitowski NOT in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:46 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins states that this case was set for both a PTC and Arraignment.
Court makes statements indicating that the defendant had been notified of today's hearings.

BY THE COURT:
Bench warrant with $500 cash alternative.


Court asks it any victim's appeared for this case; they have appeared and informed of the bench warrant with cash alternative.
Atty Cousins to speak with the victim.

10:19 a.m. Defendant William N Kitowski not in court with attorney Acalia Halverson and Atty Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Drengler and Atty Halverson are requesting withdrawal as Attorneys for Cases 15CF53(scheduled for 05-11-15), (15CT32, 15TR116, 15CM99 are on today for pretrial)- the Defendant is no longer eligible for public Defender representation. Defendant was here this morning, but has left as he is aware the Attorneys will no longer represent him.  Atty Halverson states that the Defendant should be back as he has a court hearing at 1:30 p.m. today also.
BTC: Granted and Court withholds Bench warrants until this afternoon.
Atty Drengler /s/TBE 04-23-15
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Arraignment at 05-11-2015 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 05-11-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant William N Kitowski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:31 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Officer Raasoch is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Drengler. 

Atty Drengler makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Drengler indicates he would like an arraignment on another date.  He will be filing a motion to dismiss on this case. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$5,000 sig bond:  No contact with Kenneth Firkus.

Defendant William N Kitowski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived.
State requests $5,000 sig bond:  No contact with Kenneth Firkus.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
